Name: Food Bank For New York City
Description: NYC's major hunger-relief organization providing free food through 1,000+ soup kitchens and food pantries across five boroughs, plus SNAP enrollment assistance

Name: City Harvest Mobile Markets
Location: Various locations across NYC (check website for schedule)
Description: Free farmers' market-style food distributions in high-need neighborhoods, offering fresh produce, whole grains, and healthy proteins with recipes and nutrition education

Name: The Bowery Mission
Description: Serves three hot meals daily to anyone in need, no questions asked, plus groceries through their community food pantry and special holiday meal programs

Name: St. John's Bread & Life
Description: Brooklyn's largest emergency food provider offering hot meals, mobile soup kitchen, pantry bags with 3-day food supply, and emergency food deliveries for homebound individuals

Name: Holy Apostles Soup Kitchen
Description: NYC's largest emergency feeding program serving 1,000+ hot meals every weekday, plus counseling services and referrals to other resources

Name: New York Common Pantry
Description: Provides hot meals, Choice Pantry groceries where clients select their own food, senior programs with home delivery, and fresh produce distributions

Name: POTS (Part of the Solution)
Description: Bronx-based organization offering daily community dining room meals, weekly pantry with fresh produce and proteins, and emergency food packages

Name: Masbia Soup Kitchen Network
Location: Multiple locations: Queens (105-47 64th Rd), Brooklyn (1372 Coney Island Ave), and more
Description: Kosher soup kitchens serving hot dinners and providing grocery packages, operating restaurant-style dining rooms with dignity and respect for all

Name: Xavier Mission's Welcome Table
Description: Serves Sunday meals and provides weekend food pantry bags, clothing, and hygiene items, with special holiday distributions and summer lunch programs

Name: NYC Emergency Food Assistance Program (EFAP)
Location: Call 311 or visit HRA centers throughout NYC
Description: City-run network connecting residents to 500+ food pantries and soup kitchens, plus help with SNAP applications and emergency food assistance

Name: Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank
Description: The region's largest food bank distributing over 40 million pounds of food annually through a network of pantries, soup kitchens, and shelters. Offers direct food distributions and connects people to local pantries.

Name: 412 Food Rescue
Description: Uses technology to redirect surplus food to nonprofits serving those in need. Partners with over 800 nonprofit partners and offers a free app to connect people with food distribution events.

Name: Jubilee Soup Kitchen
Description: Serves hot, nutritious meals Monday through Friday from 11am-1pm. No ID or proof of need required. Also provides takeaway bags with sandwiches and snacks.

Name: East End Cooperative Ministry (EECM)
Description: Operates a food pantry providing emergency food assistance to residents of East End neighborhoods. Offers both choice pantry shopping and emergency food boxes.

Name: Community Kitchen Pittsburgh
Location: 100 W Station Square Dr, Pittsburgh, PA 15219
Description: Provides free hot meals weekdays from 3:30-5:30pm and Sundays 1:30-3:30pm. Also offers culinary job training programs for individuals facing barriers to employment.

Name: Light of Life Rescue Mission
Description: Serves three free meals daily to anyone in need. Breakfast 6:30-7:30am, lunch 11:30am-12:30pm, and dinner 5:00-6:00pm. No questions asked, all are welcome.

Name: Bethlehem Haven
Description: Provides meals and emergency shelter services primarily for women. Serves lunch Monday-Friday at noon and dinner daily at 5pm. Also offers emergency food bags.

Name: Produce to People
Location: Various neighborhood locations on rotating schedule
Description: Free monthly produce distributions by Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank in underserved neighborhoods. No registration required, provides fresh fruits and vegetables while supplies last.

Name: Hazelwood Initiative Food Pantry
Description: Community food pantry open Tuesdays and Thursdays 10am-2pm. Provides emergency food assistance to Hazelwood residents and accepts SNAP benefits at their community market.

Name: St. Mary of Mercy Parish Food Pantry
Description: Downtown food pantry open Wednesdays 10am-12pm and Saturdays 9-11am. Provides groceries and personal care items to individuals and families in need, no geographic restrictions.

Name: Mother Hubbard's Cupboard
Description: Client-choice food pantry open Monday-Friday offering fresh produce, proteins, and pantry staples, plus nutrition education programs and community gardens

Name: Pantry 279 at Monroe County United Ministries
Description: Emergency food pantry providing a week's worth of groceries once per month, including fresh produce, dairy, and meat when available, plus referrals to other services

Name: Wheeler Mission Center for Men
Description: Provides three free meals daily to shelter residents and community members in need, breakfast at 6 AM, lunch at noon, and dinner at 5 PM

Name: First United Methodist Church Food Pantry
Description: Weekly food pantry open Thursdays 5:30-6:30 PM offering groceries and fresh produce to anyone in need, no proof of income required

Name: Crimson Cupboard Food Pantry (IU Students)
Location: Indiana Memorial Union, 900 E 7th Street, Bloomington, IN 47405
Description: Free food pantry specifically for IU students experiencing food insecurity, offering non-perishable items, fresh produce, and personal care products

Name: Area 10 Agency on Aging Mobile Food Pantry
Description: Mobile food pantry serving seniors 60+ at multiple sites monthly, providing free groceries including fresh produce, dairy, and shelf-stable items

Name: Bloomington Meals on Wheels
Description: Delivers nutritious meals to homebound individuals who cannot shop or cook for themselves, sliding scale fees with free meals available for those who cannot pay

Name: St. Vincent de Paul Food Pantry
Description: Emergency food assistance available Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings, providing 3-5 days of groceries per visit with fresh and non-perishable items

Name: Hoosier Hills Food Bank
Location: 2333 W Industrial Park Drive, Bloomington, IN 47404
Description: The region's largest food bank serving 6 counties, offering emergency food assistance, mobile pantries, and direct food distribution programs for individuals and families in need

Name: Community Kitchen of Monroe County
Description: Serves free hot meals Monday-Saturday from 4-6 PM, no questions asked, providing nutritious dinners to anyone in need in a welcoming environment

Name: Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank
Description: The region's largest food bank, distributing millions of pounds of food annually through a network of pantries, soup kitchens, and other agencies. Offers direct distribution programs and mobile food pantries.

Name: 412 Food Rescue
Description: Redirects perfectly good food from going to waste to people experiencing food insecurity. Partners with numerous nonprofits and uses an app to coordinate food rescue and distribution.

Name: Jubilee Kitchen
Description: Serves hot, nutritious meals three days a week (Monday, Tuesday, Thursday) from 4:30-6:00 PM. No questions asked, everyone is welcome.

Name: East End Cooperative Ministry (EECM)
Description: Provides emergency food pantry services, community meals, and fresh produce distributions. Also accepts SNAP benefits at their Community House.

Name: Light of Life Rescue Mission
Description: Serves three meals daily to anyone in need. Breakfast at 7 AM, lunch at noon, and dinner at 5 PM. Also provides emergency food boxes.

Name: Community Kitchen Pittsburgh
Location: 100 W Station Square Dr, Pittsburgh, PA 15219
Description: Provides free hot meals Monday through Friday from 11:30 AM to 12:30 PM in Hazelwood. No registration or documentation required.

Name: Bethlehem Haven
Description: Serves meals daily to women and children experiencing homelessness. Also provides emergency food bags and connects clients with SNAP benefits.

Name: Shepherd's Heart Fellowship
Description: Operates food pantry and veterans' food bank. Distributes food boxes twice monthly and provides hot meals on Saturdays.

Name: North Hills Community Outreach
Description: Provides emergency and supplemental food assistance through three food pantries. Also offers fresh produce distributions and SNAP application assistance.

Name: Wilkinsburg Community Ministry
Description: Operates emergency food pantry open Tuesday and Thursday. Provides 3-day emergency food supply and monthly supplemental groceries for registered clients.

Name: South Hills Interfaith Movement (SHIM)
Description: Operates multiple food pantries and produces weekly food distributions. Offers choice pantry model allowing clients to select their own groceries.

Name: Produce to People
Description: Free monthly produce distributions at multiple sites including churches and community centers. No registration required, first-come, first-served basis.

Name: St. Mary of Mercy Parish Food Pantry
Description: Downtown food pantry open Wednesdays from 10 AM to noon. Provides emergency food assistance and accepts referrals from social service agencies.

Name: Garfield Community Farm
Description: Offers free produce through their 'Grow Pittsburgh' program for low-income residents. Hosts weekly free farm stands during growing season.

Name: Trinity Lutheran Church Food Pantry
Description: Food pantry open Thursdays from 10 AM to noon. Serves North Side residents with emergency food assistance, no appointment needed.

Name: Brookline Christian Food Bank
Description: Serves Brookline, Carrick, and Overbrook residents. Open Tuesdays and Thursdays, provides monthly food assistance to registered families.

Name: Focus on Renewal
Description: Operates food pantry in the Hill District, open Monday through Friday. Also provides hot meals and connects residents with SNAP enrollment assistance.

Name: Squirrel Hill Food Pantry
Description: Kosher food pantry serving all regardless of faith. Open Sundays and Wednesdays, provides supplemental groceries and fresh produce when available.

Name: City Harvest Mobile Markets
Description: Mobile food pantries that visit underserved neighborhoods weekly. Provides fresh produce, dairy, and shelf-stable items at no cost.

Name: Just Harvest Fresh Access Program
Description: Doubles SNAP benefits at participating farmers markets, allowing SNAP recipients to get $2 worth of fresh produce for every $1 in benefits spent.

Name: Team Meeting Notes
Description: Weekly team sync meeting documentation

Name: Akron-Canton Regional Foodbank
Description: The region's largest hunger-relief organization providing emergency food assistance, mobile food pantries, and fresh produce distributions to individuals and families in need

Name: Haven of Rest Ministries
Description: Serves free hot meals daily to anyone in need, offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner in their dining room with no questions asked or requirements

Name: Peter Maurin Center
Description: Catholic Worker community providing free meals Monday through Friday at noon, plus emergency food pantry services for families experiencing food insecurity

Name: Trinity United Church of Christ Food Pantry
Description: Weekly food pantry distribution on Wednesdays providing groceries, fresh produce, and household essentials to neighborhood residents facing hunger

Name: The Salvation Army Akron
Description: Offers emergency food pantry, hot meal programs, and mobile feeding units that serve nutritious meals to children and families in underserved neighborhoods

Name: Good Neighbors Food Pantry
Description: Community-run food pantry open twice weekly providing free groceries, bread, and seasonal items to residents regardless of zip code or income verification

Name: Info Line Food Resource Helpline
Location: Call 2-1-1 from anywhere in Summit County
Description: 24/7 helpline connecting people to emergency food resources, SNAP enrollment assistance, and locations of food pantries and meal programs throughout Akron

Name: South Street Ministries
Description: Provides free community dinners every Tuesday and Thursday evening, plus monthly food distributions with fresh produce, dairy, and pantry staples

Name: OPEN M (Middlebury)
Description: Neighborhood food pantry and resource center offering emergency food boxes, fresh produce markets, and cooking classes to promote food security and nutrition

Name: Let's Grow Akron Community Gardens
Description: Network of community gardens where low-income residents can grow their own fresh produce for free, with seeds, tools, and education provided at no cost
